xxl.core.predicates
Class LeftBind<P>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.predicates.DecoratorPredicate<P>
      xxl.core.predicates.PredicateMetaDataPredicate<P,P>
          xxl.core.predicates.LeftBind<P>
Type Parameters:
P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
All Implemented Interfaces:
MetaDataPredicate<P,P>, Predicate<P>, Decorator<Predicate<? super P>>, MetaDataProvider<P>
public class LeftBind<P>
extends PredicateMetaDataPredicate<P,P>

This class provides a binary predicate which left (first) argument is bound to a constant object.

For example, consider the predicate Less that returns true if the first argument is less than the second. By creating a LeftBind instance 

   Predicate<Integer> p = new LeftBind<Integer>(new Less<Integer>(), 42);
p can be evaluated by calling 
   p.invoke(2);                   //predicate: 42 < 2
which corresponds to the call 
   p.invoke(42, 2);               //predicate: 42 < 2

See Also:
RightBind

invoke

public boolean invoke(java.util.List<? extends P> arguments)
Returns the result of the underlying predicate's invoke method that is called with the bound left (first) argument. The implementation of this method is 
   return predicate.invoke(constArgument, arguments.get(1));
